newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end down on political unrest.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end down on political unrest.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended down on Sunday due to political unrest which weakened market sentiment, dealers said. They said share prices were likely to open lower on Monday's settlement day.

The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index ended 7.43 points, or 0.51 percent, down at 1,442.12 amid 132 losers and 70 gainers. Volume fell to a provisional 12 million shares from Thursday's 30 million. Losers led gainers 176 to 53.
A planned opposition rally in Peshawar on Sunday also helped keep the market gloomy, one dealer said. Dewan Salman fell 2.20 rupees to 24.80. -- Ibrahim Khan 9221-5685192
Short-covering in select scrips resisted a sharp fall and may keep the index range-bounded on Monday as well, he said.
Faysal Bank fell 0.60 to 25 rupees. Adamjee Insurance rose 5.0 to 99. Dewan Salman Fibre fell 2.20 to 24.80. Hub Power Co rose 0.05 to 30.90. Pakistan State Oil fell 1.0 to 330. PTCL fell 0.20 to 36.
